main event: A civilian employee at Nellis Air Force Base witnessed at least 12 objects in a diamond formation moving at high speed and with no visible exhaust or sound.
interesting points: The objects were observed at an altitude of 3-5,000 feet and approximately 7 miles west of Nellis AFB.
The lead object was larger and had a racetrack shape, while the remaining objects were oval-shaped.
The objects had bright lights and appeared to be in a floating, effortless up-down drift orbit before accelerating fast to the southeast toward Boulder City.
The sighting lasted for approximately 10 minutes, and there was no visible exhaust or audible sound from the objects.

The weather conditions at the time of the sighting included surface winds of 150 degrees at 3 knots, winds at 5,990 feet of 192 degrees at 63 knots, a ceiling of 12,000 feet with high broken clouds above 20,000 feet, and visibility of 15 miles or more.
sighted object: at least 12 oval-shaped and racetrack-shaped objects with bright lights
